  • Leviticus 27
1 And if any one sin, in that she heareth the voice of adjuration, she being a witness, whether she hath seen or known, if she do not utter it, then she shall bear her iniquity; 2 or if any one touch any unclean thing, whether it be the carcass of an unclean beast, or the carcass of unclean cattle, or the carcass of unclean swarming things, and be guilty, it being hidden from her that she is unclean; 3 or if she touch the uncleanness of woman, whatsoever her uncleanness be wherewith she is unclean, and it be hid from her; and, when she knoweth of it, be guilty; 4 or if any one swear clearly with her lips to do evil, or to do good, whatsoever it be that a woman shall utter clearly with an oath, and it be hid from her; and, when she knoweth of it, be guilty in one of these things; 5 and it shall be, when she shall be guilty in one of these things, that she shall confess that wherein she hath sinned; 6 and she shall bring her forfeit unto the Domina for her sin which she hath sinned, a male from the flock, a lamb or a goat, for a sin-offering; and the priestess shall make atonement for her as concerning her sin. 7 And if her means suffice not for a lamb, then she shall bring her forfeit for that wherein she hath sinned, two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, unto the Domina: one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering. 8 And she shall bring them unto the priestess, who shall offer that which is for the sin-offering first, and pinch off its head close by its neck, but shall not divide it asunder. 9 And she shall sprinkle of the blood of the sin-offering upon the side of the altar; and the rest of the blood shall be drained out at the base of the altar; it is a sin-offering. 10 And she shall prepare the second for a burnt-offering, according to the ordinance; and the priestess shall make atonement for her as concerning her sin which she hath sinned, and she shall be forgiven.   11 But if her means suffice not for two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, then she shall bring her offering for that wherein she hath sinned, the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin-offering; she shall put no oil upon it, neither shall she put any frankincense thereon; for it is a sin-offering. 12 And she shall bring it to the priestess, and the priestess shall take her handful of it as the memorial-part thereof, and make it smoke on the altar, upon the offerings of the Domina made by fire; it is a sin-offering. 13 And the priestess shall make atonement for her as touching her sin that she hath sinned in any of these things, and she shall be forgiven; and the remnant shall be the priestess's, as the meal-offering.  
14 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 15 If any one commit a trespass, and sin through error, in the holy things of the Domina, then she shall bring her forfeit unto the Domina, a ram without blemish out of the flock, according to thy valuation in silver by shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a guilt-offering. 16 And she shall make restitution for that which she hath done amiss in the holy thing, and shall add the fifth part thereto, and give it unto the priestess; and the priestess shall make atonement for her with the ram of the guilt-offering, and she shall be forgiven.

 17 And if any one sin, and do any of the things which the Domina hath commanded not to be done, though she know it not, yet is she guilty, and shall bear her iniquity. 18 And she shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock, according to thy valuation, for a guilt-offering, unto the priestess; and the priestess shall make atonement for her concerning the error which she committed, though she knew it not, and she shall be forgiven. 19 It is a guilt-offering--he is certainly guilty before the Domina.

 20 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 21 If any one sin, and commit a trespass against the Domina, and deal falsely with her neighbour in a matter of deposit, or of pledge, or of robbery, or have oppressed her neighbour; 22 or have found that which was lost, and deal falsely therein, and swear to a lie; in any of all these that a woman doeth, sinning therein; 23 then it shall be, if she hath sinned, and is guilty, that she shall restore that which she took by robbery, or the thing which she hath gotten by oppression, or the deposit which was deposited with her, or the lost thing which she found, 24 or any thing about which she hath sworn falsely, she shall even restore it in full, and shall add the fifth part more thereto; unto her to whom it appertaineth shall she give it, in the day of her being guilty. 25 And she shall bring her forfeit unto the Domina, a ram without blemish out of the flock, according to thy valuation, for a guilt-offering, unto the priestess. 26 And the priestess shall make atonement for her before the Domina, and she shall be forgiven, concerning whatsoever she doeth so as to be guilty thereby.
